page.description: Style 'tweaks' can be used to customize an Alpha Anywhere style (such as the Alpha style).

discussion.p: Style 'tweaks' can be defined in the UX Component's properties. Once a style has been tweaked, tweaks can be modified directly in the Web Theme Builder.

description.p: With the Alpha Style selected, click the [...] smart field button for the *[ui:Style sub-theme and CSS 'tweaks']* property.
Tweak the style by adding sub-themes on the *[ui:Sub-themes]* tab and/or defining custom CSS on the *[ui:CSS]* tab. Your CSS can include Sass.

figure.title: This 'tweak' adds a shadow to all buttons in the theme.

description.p: Save the tweaks and preview the changes in Live or Working Preview.

figure.title: Buttons in our app now display with a shadow.

section.title: Modifying a Tweaked Style in the Web Theme Builder

description.p: From the Web Projects Control Panel, open the *[ui:Menu]* and select *[ui:Open Web Style Builder]*.
Select the *[ui:Alpha]* theme from the list.

The Web Theme Builder opens in Tweak mode (indicated by the text "tweak" after the style name in the title bar.) Enter new or modify existing tweaks on the *[ui:Code]* tab. Preview any adjustments made on the *[ui:Adjust]* tab.
Save your changes when you are done tweaking the style.

figure.title: Modifications are made on the Code tab in the Web Theme Builder
